isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (356 MM) AND 15 1/2-INCH (394 MM) TWO-PLATE, PULL-TYPE CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT - CLUTCH

svcprocinfo.para: To assure correct clutch operation and long service life of clutch components, the clutch and the clutch control linkage must be properly adjusted.
Two types of adjustments must be made: (1) Clutch internal (release bearing) adjustment, (2) External (pedal and linkage) adjustment.
For external (linkage) adjustment procedures, refer to GROUP 11 - LINKAGE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the vehicle being serviced.

caution.para: Do not change external (linkage) adjustments without first checking the clutch internal adjustment. Changing the external adjustment will not compensate for an improperly adjusted clutch.

svcsubproc.title: Internal Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: The procedures for the clutch internal adjustments are outlined below.

Some clutches have a self-adjusting feature which automatically compensates for wear of clutch disc facings. However initial settings must be established by manual adjustment at the time of clutch service.

step1.para: Check clearance between release bearing housing and clutch brake disc ( Figure 48). This dimension must be 1/2 to 9/16 inch.

figure.caption: Figure 48. Check Clearance Between Release Bearing Housing and Clutch Brake Disc

note.para: Clutch brake in vehicle may differ in appearance from that illustrated.

step1.para: If release bearing clearance (Step 1) is more or less than specified dimension, the clutch requires an internal adjustment.
Rotate engine flywheel until adjusting ring lock is exposed.

step2.para: Fork Style Lock - Remove the fork ( Figure 49). Use a screwdriver to turn the internal adjusting ring.
Self Adjust - Remove the right bolt and loosen the left bolt and pivot the adjuster upward ( Figure 50). Use a screwdriver to turn the internal adjusting ring.
Kwik Adjust - Push in and turn ( Figure 51).
Positive Adjust (Reman.) - Remove lockstrap and turn.

step1.para: Release clutch by blocking pedal in depressed position.
Turn adjusting ring to achieve the 1/2 to 9/16 inch specification.
When specified release bearing clearance is obtained, reassemble the locking device.

note.para: The clutch will not self-adjust if the actuator arm ball is not inserted into the release sleeve retainer or release bearing travel is less than 1/2 inch (12.7 mm).

step1.para: Check the clearance between the release yoke fingers and the pads on the release bearing housing. This dimension must be 1/8 inch.
To set the 1/8 inch specification, the linkage must be adjusted. Refer to GROUP 11 - LINKAGE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the model being serviced.
Insert a .010 inch feeler gauge between the release bearing housing and the clutch brake to verify brake squeeze when the clutch pedal is depressed.
If the clutch brake squeeze is not achieved, check for worn linkage components or correct reassembly.

note.para: Do not change the internal adjustment.
